newsitem.title: GERMANY: Czechs welcome Kohl's reconciliation gesture.
newsitem.headline: Czechs welcome Kohl's reconciliation gesture.

text.p: The Czech embassador in Bonn welcomed on Thursday remarks by Chancellor Helmut Kohl that he hoped a post-war reconciliation accord would be concluded by the end of the year.
In an interview with German Radio Ambassador Jiri Grusa welcomed Kohl's remarks made on Wednesday in a keynote address to parliament as "new and positive".
"Kohl spoke in clear language which is receiving much attention from the Czech public," Grusa said.

This came as a "wonderful addition" to recent remarks by German president Roman Herzog, who stressed the inviolability of today's border with Poland at a meeting of people expelled from areas now part of Poland and Russia.

The German-Czech talks, now running for over a year, are intended to close the book on both the Nazi occupation of Czechoslovakia and the subsequent expulsion of millions of ethnic Germans from the country.

Kohl pleaded for patience in his parliamentary address. "We want to conclude this agreement this year," he said, adding that he wanted it to be symbolically crowned by a speech in Bonn by a representative of the Czech government.
